body.note: This is a super-element. It is recorded by recording one or more of its sub-elements rather than recording it directly.
This element is usually not recorded in favor of its more specific element subtypes, but the element page contains instructions and policy statements applicable to one or more narrower elements.
For detailed examples and guidance in recording parallel data in MARC, consult .

LC-PCC practice for relationship elements: Do not record the name of the element in 100/110/700/710 $e or $i or 111/711 $j in the MARC bibliographic format, or in 500/510/511 $i in the authority format. Instead, record the corresponding PCC relationship label for the element.

p.ph: Prefer recording narrower elements or sub-elements separately in more specific subfields rather than in $a unless required by local policy.
